question: A clinic has a capacity of 600 rooms with 1/4 occupied. Due to the pandemic, 20 patients are admitted into the clinic each day. Calculate the total number of unoccupied rooms in the clinic after 2 weeks.
answer:
If 1/4 of the total capacity of the clinic rooms is occupied, it means 1/4 * 600 = <<600*1/4=150>>150 rooms have patients using them.
The total number of rooms in the clinic without new admissions is 600 rooms - 150 rooms = <<600-150=450>>450 rooms.
If 20 people are admitted each day, the total number of patients in the clinic after one week is 20 patients/day * 7 days/week = 140 patients.
After 2 weeks, the total number of patients admitted into the clinic is 140 patients/week * 2 weeks = <<140*2=280>>280 patients, who each use one room.
If there were 450 unoccupied rooms in the clinic before the new admissions, the total number is reduced to 450 rooms - 280 rooms = <<450-280=170>>170 unoccupied rooms.
#### 170
